reviews.content: Based in Pitlochry and owned by independent bottler Signatory Vintage, Edradour remains one of the smallest distilleries in Scotland. Rich honey sweetness, heather and a diffuse flowery scent encounter the nose on first contact. Very nice, but obviously young. Something bothers me on the palate. It is neither the sweet maltiness, paired with oranges and spices, nor the soft and creamy character. There is something sharp and herbaceous that is hard to pin down. The finish is fairly short with honey and bitter nuts. Not a bad malt, but slightly disjointed.RATING: 3.0/5.0 stars ≙ 79 pts → AVERAGE
Tasting note under the 50 ml edition.
Tasted at WTF 2018

Nose:- Unique. Oily and creamy fragrance zests with sherry notes. Black olive come to mind, alluring.  Palate:- Milky soft texture but complex in flavours. Sherry and dark fruits greets you with tasty creaminess, follow by prickly and soft sourish fruits, with a touch of toasted spices. Slightly fade and thin on mouth coating,  Finish:- Plum and vanilla emerge, long and chili finish. But a light kick back reflects the young age.— at The Whisky Bar, Kuala Lumpur.
very good beginner, despite the watery mouthfeel, the flavors are transported quite well
reviews.nose: slightly floral, fruity, ripe, almost fermented pear, vanilla, overall rather sweet
reviews.taste: slightly watery mouthfeel, again fermented fruit, apple and pears, sweet, vanilla, slightly tart, pleasant to drink, after the first sip the intensity decreases slightly
reviews.finish: becoming bitter, the fruit becomes sour, now clear pear, creamy

reviews.content: 2020 Rating

YeastFor the longest time Edradour has had a not-so-good reputation (I am being polite), but since Andrew Symington took over in 2002, lots of pearls have appeared from this small distillery in Pitlochry. Maybe the current 10 Year Old is made with their own spirit, but I am still trying an older bottling, from 2009. This means it was distilled in the Pernod-Ricard age.The nose is a little bit of a stinker (but less bad than I remember from 6 years ago). A touch of sink is surrounded by some dried fruits on the one hand (think sultanas and apples) and some nuts on the other (mostly almonds). It has a bit of a sulphury side, but that quickly evaporates to make room for slightly burnt caramel.It is quite oily – almost syrupy – with a malty heart, but also a yeasty edge as it were. The dried fruit and nuts from the nose return, upholstered with some juicy honey. Woodsmoke rears its head. And yet it also has a bitter and somewhat sour edge that makes me think some bad casks were involved (which is probably BS, but that’s how I feel).The finish is fairly long with an uppercut of nutmeg at the death.This remains to me a ‘difficult’ whisky to enjoy. Too many offnotes if you ask me. Just under 40 EUR.

Different for sure. I can see why some really can‘t stand this. Yeasty, musty, sulphury, farmy, cheesy. Funnily enough, some bottles of this bear traces of peat smoke, while others don’t. I’d say the smoke improves it; unfortunately my current bottle appears to be smoke-free.You can‘t deny the quality of the sherry-cask maturation involved here, though. Nice, rich, "old-style" oloroso notes create a savory impression, somewhere between Chinese plum wine and Worcester sauce (umami). The more unlikely aromas appear to subside with continuous nosing, the whole heads more and more in the direction of some dark, gamey broth. However, the low strength indubitably hurts it. Watery body, but even at 40% ABV you can detect the underlying, substantial character. Dry, nutty, dark fruity sherry attacks first, then come some (subdued) sweet notes and finally a serious, oaky, prickly bitterness, which, again, may be too much for some. That being said, I kind of dig what it does and can see this as a dessert dram that would stand up well against some strong cheeses or heavy fare like dark mousse-au-chocolat.An outlier in the field of entry-level OB‘s, but can you really criticize character? I think not. Solid 82-83 points.
Sweet, oak, cooked fruit, a little sherry, crisp and fresh round and satisfying. Beautiful Highlander. Again and again!
This was a big disappointment for me.
Got this as a presant off my wife, i've always wanted it and was gutted to find it very ordinary. A lovely distillery but not a lovely malt
reviews.nose: Floral and fruity and light on the body
reviews.taste: A warming taste with little bits of honey and almonds
reviews.finish: A little sweet and a little short

reviews.content: - a long time ago but wasn't so enthusiastic - good standard but also "only" the entrance to the distillery to get to know (all previous bottlings were better) - a strong, strong character - little sherry, rather more oak and spicy aromas in the taste

reviews.nose: Fruity with a slight touch of glue. Honey. Freshly sawn fir wood.
reviews.taste: Nutty bitterness. Bright fruits. Laundry detergent.

reviews.content: @karloffC'mon, it is not that bad. It is just a 10 year old single malt scotch, nothing more, nothing less. ;-)
An inusual light and floreal highlander. Fascinated by the uniìusual scents but disappointed by the flavour too light and simply for a highland. Too expensive for his medium quality.

reviews.nose: Floreal - violet??, sherry.
reviews.taste: Light sherry, soft barley and flreal
reviews.finish: Light boody and short finish with a hint of sherry

reviews.content: This one has actually improved over the years, it seems to me. I guess the batches vary heavily.

It is a pity that it is watery and could be much richer with a slightly higher strength of 46%. Very pleasant, drinkable whisky for the sweet tooth and lovers of good sherry whisky! I don't understand why the average rating is so low. Excellent drinking whisky - a real Scottish gem! N:22 T:21 F:22 B:20
reviews.nose: Dusty leather armchair, fruity, prune, sweet and dense, chocolate, apricot, raisin, very appetizing, tannic, classic sherry sulphur. A few drops of water reveal the perfume.
reviews.taste: Chocolate, dried apricots, almost cloying, sugar candy, a lot of raisins and black oily prunes, refined sunflower oil, quite watery, light pleasant bitterness. A few drops of water are a nice touch, revealing grapey and sweet soft dried fruits. The distillery's signature subtle yeasty profile is well recognizable.
reviews.finish: Wood tannins, black oily prunes, bright sherry dryness, astringency in the mouth, confident pleasant tannin bitterness of oak extractives. Long lasting, bright and pleasant!

reviews.content: In terms of price, but still to wean off. This bottle is unlikely to make anyone a whisky lover. On the surface, these three words strike: sour, bitter, out-of-round.
reviews.nose: Quite unbalanced sherry nose, very tart and slightly spicy. Cranberries, red wine, anise, cloves, blood orange, fermented pomegranate, damp leaves lying on the ground in autumn.
reviews.taste: Watery and still spicy alcohol. Sour and bitter. The taste is otherwise an aromatic reflection of the nose.
reviews.finish: Medium-length finish with clear tannins, some ash and grapefruit.

reviews.content: Blind tasting:  Nose: sweet, coffee, dark caramel, baking plums, dates, everything a little fleeting  Flavor: initially very mild, then delayed intensive seasoning with nuts, clear sherry barrel,  Finish: medium length with nice sweetness and balanced spice  Since my wife gave me the tip that it wasn't a Speysider, I bet on Edradour  Conclusion: balanced, complex good drop with slight weakness on the nose, 85/100
one of my favorite distilleries and my favorite standard OA, but more polarizing than pleasing and quite idiosyncratic
reviews.nose: Jam (strawberry, cherry), some marzipan, toffee, a hint of old leather and tobacco
reviews.taste: nutty-spicy-sweet, nougat, dark chocolate, sugar beet syrup, leather, tobacco, even some earthy notes, licorice, dusty-dry mouthfeel
reviews.finish: long, spicy, tobacco, licorice

reviews.content: I like! I'm a bit baffled by the poor ratings ... (78 on average ?!?)

reviews.nose: Apple, citrus, some menthol
reviews.taste: very oily, a little apple, a bit bitterness, definitely light in the mouth
reviews.finish: Rather short and clearly more aggressive than one would expect

reviews.content: Quite promising nose but then there´s somethig in the taste I don´t like at all. Hard to decribe. Tastes kinda flowery and soapy.

This whisky shows character, but rather a rebellious one. It's certainly distinct, but the greasy mouthfeel it produces, too reminiscent of a pair of fries soaked in fryer grease, puts me off. Well, not my cup of tea!
reviews.nose: Dark beer, very malty, a bit of dates and figs, a slight influence of the sherry casks can be seen, hay, ripe bananas, sulphurous grapes
reviews.taste: Lots of malt at the beginning, quite greasy, pepper and cloves, acrid and sulphurous, tree sap, molasses
reviews.finish: Rather short, malty, the hay comes through again, feels as if it had left a light greasy coating on the palate, a bit of chocolate (rather dark), the grapes show a bitter skin

reviews.content: Not one of the best, but certainly not one of the worst.
reviews.nose: Vanilla.  Sweet fruit. Hints of sherry. Apple crisp..
reviews.taste: Bananas Foster. Creamy  and light. Hazelnut biscuits.  Flower shoppe.
reviews.finish: Mellow. Fresh. Rather short.

reviews.content: Horror. The best example of when there is a nose, but there is no taste, or rather, it is simply terrible.  Nose: Sivuha ... Real moonshine ...  Let stand.  Smoked, prunes, mash (wine) ...  Taste: trash, right away ... I tried the moonshine better, but it's Single Molt ...  Finish: sweet sherry, but without a foundation ...
Actually quite pleasant to drink, but there is little substance.
reviews.nose: Pear in the nose, some hay and overall rather sweet.
reviews.taste: Immediately on the palate again the pear, otherwise not really much and everything superficial. It rinses on the palate but does not really do much. I really tried to keep it long in my mouth, but as a result, that does not change anything.
reviews.finish: Very short, here too the pear. But at least nothing unpleasant.

reviews.content: Pretty telling. 58P.
reviews.nose: Honey sweetness, cereals, slightly floral.
reviews.taste: Flat, discreetly sweet, malty.
reviews.finish: In short, cereals.

reviews.content: uuh. one of the worst whiskies I ever had. plastic, fake fruit esther & something I couldn't place my finger on (paper/cardboard...?). The only whisky related drinks I found more unpleaseant were some new spirits, and hey, they don't pretend to be whiskies.

S 5Overall unexciting. Would drink if it was the only option. The nose shows a classic example of what if sherried cask goes wrong. Rather than a whisky to taste, I would say it's a dessert drink.N 22Excessive sherry brings aroma like sticky oil clotted on the stove. Some espresso beans. The nose is thick but still feeling the spirit poking here and there. Barley sugar and oak wood were masked by the sherry influences.P 25Very sherry (nutty, dried fruit, raisins). It's quite malty and developing some warm winter spices over time. Some wine tannin underpinned the entire time alongside some honey in distance.F 22Short-Mid, dry finish. Some oak spices and boiled fruit notes lingering.
Unfortunately very watery.

reviews.nose: Minty. Leafy.
reviews.taste: Syrupy. Smoky.
reviews.finish: Barbecue. Charcoal.

reviews.content: I remember when I opened the bottle I found it quite intense in the pepper and cloves. Now a year later I find it quite flat and watery in the palette and aftertaste. Clearly a whisky that should not be left open too long.
reviews.nose: honey, toffee, dried fruit, little bit of leather, orange, floral perfume, figs, cloves, cinnamon,
reviews.taste: almond, orange, cloves, butter,
reviews.finish: black pepper, short, tannins of wood, slightly watery.

reviews.content: A straight-lined 10-year-old single malt from a sympathetic distillery without much to overwhelm - 22.02.2014
reviews.nose: Malt, sherry, raisins
reviews.taste: Malt sweetness, spicy, woody note
reviews.finish: medium

reviews.content: Soft and comfortable, you could drink it for hours. Best choice to drink a glass (or more) with friends without having to discuss to much over this bottling. This is a classic for me, so I imagine a good standard of whisky. Soft and pleasant to drink. Honey with some herbs and a hint of smoke on the palate with a medium finish.

reviews.nose: Malty sweetness with light sherry fruits, honey, nutty notes and oak aromas.
reviews.taste: Nutty notes with caramel, ripe fruit, spices and oak aromas.
reviews.finish: Long with sherry fruits, caramel, spices, nutty notes and oak aromas.

reviews.content: doesn't make me nervous but okay
reviews.nose: Torf, Äpfel, Vanille etwas maritim und einen Hauch SalzBratapfel (Fass) etwas Medizin, wenig Leder oder Torf jetzt kommt Fallobst
reviews.taste: milder Antritt Popcorn, wässrig, Mirabelle, Salz, Kräuter etwas Schnapsfeeling Wieder Kräuteram Gaumen etwas bitter
reviews.finish: warmes Apfelfleisch mürbe im Wechsel mit Lakritze .. etwas bitter, Fassnoten, leicht faulig,

reviews.content: Slightly weak and simple. Maybe 40% abv is not enough for it. The nose is promising, but taste mostly empty
nice allrounder, good daily dram and not boring

reviews.nose: Meadowland flowers, sweetness, light tangerine, washingformula, barley, hay, a little bit of nuts and honey.
reviews.taste: Very flat, it starts with sweetness, but it doesn'tlast long. There is a lot of dryness, possibly some sourness, bitterness andvery unpleasant impression.
reviews.finish: Very short and rubbish.

reviews.content: A very good whisky for a 10 year old Scotsman. The almost 50 € are also in order. Definitely a buy recommendation.
reviews.nose: sweet malt, sherry, vanilla, spices
reviews.taste: mild and creamy, cereal, sweet
reviews.finish: Medium length, dry, creamy with spicy notes

reviews.content: Still seems to undergo strong batch variations. Had my horror stories with Edradours over time (interestingly less so with Ballechins!), but a recent bottle of 10 I tried was pretty solid. Nothing to write home about but not worse than other entry level bottlings.
Like for a standard with 40% and "only" 10 years surprisingly well. 85 points
reviews.nose: Sherry pretty prominent. Slightly cheesy, greasy odor. Baked apple and orange grated. Vanilla.
reviews.taste: Amazingly rich in flavors for 40%. Very prominent pastry and bread notes. Spice cake with dried fruits. Again quite a lot of vanilla notes. Soft, aromatic and in no way watery. Nice!
reviews.finish: Medium long and soft without any bitterness. Spicy dryness.

reviews.content: Great sherried expression with a short finish and a huge price tag.
Tasted on 03-04-2021.
5 cl sample notes.
reviews.nose: Very winey, reminds me of cheap brandy with this overpowering sweet/sour nose, some grapes, vanilla and not much more.
reviews.taste: Very forgettable. Some faint notes of sherry, nuts, but nothing too distinctive.
reviews.finish: Quite long what is not exactly a good thing in this case. Better than the nose, though.

reviews.content: caledonia is much better unfortunately(
Tried again in 2022 in the Fortingall Hotel. Much, much better than the last one I tried. A very drinkable, sherried dram.
Too much butter and too creamy, but for those looking for this profile do not hesitate
reviews.nose: walnut honey apple plum
reviews.taste: butter, creamy, floral and evolves on spices
reviews.finish: fruitee, evolve on the caramel

reviews.content: The nose is just great, the palate isn't really synchronized with the nose. The finish is a bit disappointing. One dram only, so I feel like I have to buy a bottle to really investigate. Recently I have become very interested this distillery since I've tasted a couple of "straight from the casks". Fabulous stuff really! I think this entry level malt needs more investigation.(Rating interval 79-84)
reviews.nose: floral with jasmine and roses, sweet, white sugar, some cotton candy or meringue. Some orange rind, orange candy (Tic tac) and oak.
reviews.taste: sweet initial but changes rapidly to more bitter citrus, lemon rind, grapefruit, lime juice and black pepper. The floral notes contains violets now.
reviews.finish: The finish is short and sharp. lemon pepper, nothing else.

reviews.content: Water is obligatory! Gets much softer, mellower and, what the heck, much better anyways. That will release marmalade, cherries, confiture, plum jelly, walnuts, nutmeg, bitter wood, flan, dark chocolate, cocoa. Sure it needs few drops of water to be added.
reviews.nose: Pretty odd and unusual. Spring orchard, blossoming cherry-trees, grass-plot, sour grapes, green apple, lemon, bunch of fresh daisies, bubbling yeast, foamy, sultanas?, acacia honey, clay. Slow down and take your time, aromas will evolve into marshmallow, lemon candies, air freshener with lilies-of-the-valley and dandelions sappy notes, a heap of old books on earth floor, stale yellow pages scattered everywhere, for dessert you have got warmed-up crème caramel. Enjoy your meal!
reviews.taste: Again, I got some flaws and off-notes here. Creamy, somewhat mineral (granite-like), charcoal, ugh! - acrid sulphur, loads of it, wild honey, barley sugar candy, roasted peanuts, dry white wine. After that citrus acidity and bitterness break in, it's getting vinegary, waxy, cany (sugar cane?), varnish, whitewash, slightly fusty oak barrel, cardboard packaging?, zest, tea leaves. Edgy, prickling, medium-bodied, quite nervous, for me it's just not round enough.
reviews.finish: Medium to long finish. Fierce on spice, citrus, acerbic, slightly salty, herbal. Sour apple, sage, horseradish?, fennel, vermouth, liquorice, cloves, pepper, ginger, grapefruit tinge, lime/lemon rind, green apricots, eau de Cologne, charred wood, chicory.

reviews.content: Whisky is very accessible, refined sweetness. Reminiscent of sweet apricot. Finish is short, but intense.
reviews.nose: Sweet, real whisky scent.
reviews.taste: Taste a little sharp on the tongue and then a caramel softness.
reviews.finish: Intensive
